snippet: Purdue Pharma, the maker of OxyContin, says it has completed testing of an abuse-resistant version of the painkiller hydrocodone, which could derail sales of the recently introduced Zohydro.
abstract: Purdue Pharma, maker of OxyContin, says it has completed testing of an abuse-resistant version of the painkiller hydrocodone; surprise development could derail sales of Zohydro, pain medication made by Zogenix, that has been heavily criticized for lacking such safeguards.
lead_paragraph: Purdue Pharma, the maker of OxyContin, says it has completed testing of an abuse-resistant version of the painkiller hydrocodone, which could derail sales of the recently introduced Zohydro.

headline.main: Abuse-Resistant Hydrocodone Could Sink Sales of New Drug
headline.print_headline: Company Says It Has Abuse-Resistant Hydrocodone
